com.hippikon.security.crypto
Class DESSecretKeyGenerator

java.lang.Object
  com.hippikon.security.crypto.DESSecretKeyGenerator
public class DESSecretKeyGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

DESSecretKeyGenerator is a command line driven utility class that generates a SecretKey using DES strong encryption and persists in a key file specified as a command line argument. The secret key may then be used encrypt and decrypt data for applications.

If the key is compromised, a new key must be generated. Some manual invervention may be required in order to prevent existing encrypted data from being unavailable.

To use this class you will need to setup and install an encryption DES provider, which can be downloaded from Sun JCE Page.

Examples

To create a new key locked with password 'my-password' in a file named 'mykey.ser' issue the following command at a shell prompt:

 java com.hippikon.security.crypto.DESSecretKeyGenerator mykey.ser 'my-password'
To create a key in application code:

 DESSecretKeyGenerator keygen = new DESSecretKeyGenerator();
 SecretKey key1 = keygen.generateKey("my-password");
 SecretKey key2 = keygen.generateKey("my-other-password");

Since:
JDK 1.2.2
Version:

Author:

Constructor Detail

DESSecretKeyGenerator

public DESSecretKeyGenerator(java.lang.String filename,
                             java.lang.String password)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a new DESSecretKeyGenerator object using a specified password and filename to store the key as a seralized object.

Parameters:
filename - the file where the generated SecretKey will be stored using Serialization
password - a String to use as the salt for the key generation. If NULL or a blank string, a default password will be used that is >38 characters in length.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - thrown if the DESSecretKeyGenerator could not be initialized

DESSecretKeyGenerator

public DESSecretKeyGenerator()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new DESSecretKeyGenerator that uses the default password. The key will not be stored as a serialized object.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the password is NULL or < 8 characters
Method Detail

generateKey

public javax.crypto.SecretKey generateKey(java.lang.String password)
                                   throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                          java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                          java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
Generates a SecretKey using a password provided. This method is provided for convenience should a client wish to quickly create a transient SecretKey. If the two argument constructor was called, this method will not replace the SecretKey already generated and seralized to the specified filename.

The intended use of this method is:

 DESSecretKeyGenerator keygen = new DESSecretKeyGenerator();
 SecretKey key = keygen.generateKey("my-bad-password");
 // do something with the key

Parameters:
password - a String used to generate the SecretKey
Returns:
a SecretKey object generated using the password provided in the object constructor
Throws:
java.security.InvalidKeyException - thrown if the key could not be generated
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - thrown if the encryption algorithm could not be loaded
java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException - thrown if the encryption algorithm is not available

makeBytesFromDESKey

public byte[] makeBytesFromDESKey(javax.crypto.SecretKey key)
                           throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                  java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
Creates a KeySpec from a given SecretKey.

Parameters:
key - the SecretKey object to translate to bytes
Returns:
the DES key material in a byte array
Throws:
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException

makeDESKey

public static javax.crypto.SecretKey makeDESKey(byte[] input,
                                                int offset)
                                         throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException,
                                                java.security.InvalidKeyException
This method translates a KeySpec into a SecretKey.

Parameters:
input - a byte array of DES key data
offset - the offset in key, where the DES key material starts
Throws:
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
java.security.InvalidKeyException

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a new SecretKey using a specified filename and optional password. If a password is provided it is safest to quote the password string. Usage

 java com.hippikon.security.crypto.DESSecretKeyGenerator <filename> [password]

To view a Help menu, pass in the '-h' option as the first command line argument

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
